messages.title: I'm voting Labour
messages.content: James Cunningham for West Bromwich West

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS that works for the many, not the few
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scrapping prescription charges, hospital car parking charges, and stopping the sell-off of the service to corporations.
Labour will establish a National Education Service that ensures everyone can thrive and succeed in life.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Ending Low Pay Britain and Scrapping Universal Credit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will establish a £10 an hour real living wage, ban zero hours contracts and scrap Universal Credit.

issues.economy: Ending low pay, real living wage, scrapping Universal Credit
issues.education: Reducing class sizes, National Education Service
issues.health: NHS, scrapping prescription charges, hospital car parking charges

leaflet.personalStatement: I have spent most of my career working for the NHS, starting as a temp and working my way up. I saw the improvements under Labour Government – but things have become dramatically worse under the Tories.

politicalExperience.role: Labour candidate for the West Bromwich West
politicalExperience.achievements: Career working for the NHS, witnessing improvements under Labour and a decline under the Tories.

endorsements.endorser: Ahmadul Haque, MBE, former Lord Mayor of Sandwell
endorsements.endorsement: James will be an excellent MP for West Bromwich West as he is part of the new generation of grassroots politicians.

endorsements.endorser: Dharminder Chauhan, Lecturer at Sandwell College and UCU branch chair
endorsements.endorsement: "Education belongs at the heart of our communities, West Bromwich West needs a representative that will foster strong links between our families and schools. We should always get the politician we vote for, James Cunningham has my confidence as an advocate and community champion."

leaflet.additionalNotes: My pledges to you: £10 an hour living wage for over 16s, Free TV licences for everyone over 75, Scrap hospital car parking charges, Scrap NHS prescription charges, Scrap Universal Credit
